Quick search

API-Application Programming Interface¶

application¶

application¶

class application.app.Application¶

SMRC is a application to record experiment with digital camera automatically and evaluate the experiment with ncorr.

initialize()¶

Initialize the application.

class application.app.StartDialog(parent)¶

The StartDialog will show when initializing the application.

initialize()¶

Performs the initializing of the application.

show(task)¶

Show the StartDialog and initialize the application in the background.

Parameters:task (Built-in function) – Task
class application.app.StartDialogHandler¶

Handles the StartDialog. The handler makes sure that the StartDialog will close when the initialization is done.

class application.smrc_handler.SMRCHandler¶

Handles the interaction with the SMRCModel and the SMRCWindow.

load_experiment(info)¶

Loads the experiment.

load_project(info)¶

Loads the project.

open_tutorial(info)¶

Opens the tutorial for the application

save_experiment(info)¶

Saves the experiment.

save_project(info)¶

Saves the project.

application.smrc_handler.imread(filename[, flags]) → retval¶
class application.smrc_model.SMRCModel(record_mode)¶

The object SMRCModel manages the course of the experiment. It contains a model and a handler. The handler make sure that the a experiment can not restart while it is running. The model contains the phases and address the measuring card if the camera should take a picture.

is_valid()¶

Checks whether the experiment is valid

load_project(fpath='', from_server=False, project='')¶

Loads the project

Parameters:
  • fpath (string) – Name of the file
  • from_server (Bool) – True if the project should be load from the server
  • project (string) – Name of the project
save_experiment(fpath)¶

Saves the attributes of the experiment.

Parameters:fpath (string) – Path to the file
Returns:True, if the experiment was saved, False otherwise
Return type:bool
save_project(fpath)¶

Save the project

Parameters:fpath (string) – Path to the file
Returns:True, if the experiment was saved, False otherwise
Return type:bool
class application.smrc_window.SMRCWindow(model)¶

SMRCWindow is the Mainwindow of the application SmartRecord. The window shows the time and the current phase of the experiment when it’s running. Furthermore the window interacts with the SMRCModel and make it possible that the user can start and cancel the experiment by clicking a icon.

start_clock()¶

Run the clock in the status bar.

basic_modules¶

basic_classes¶

class basic_modules.basic_classes.Combobox¶

Combobox in traits.

add_item(key, value)¶

Add a item in the dictionary and show it in the combobox

Parameters:
  • key (string) – Key which should show in the combobox
  • value (object) – Belonging value
add_listener(listener)¶

Makes it possible that the parents can be notify when the selected_key has changed.

Parameters:listener (object) – Parent object
reset()¶

Resets all entries of the dictionary

show_value(value)¶

Shows the key of the given value

Parameters:value (object) – Belonging value

Returns:Name of the image, (past time, recorded value)
Return type:(string, list)

Return type:int

Thread which start automatically with the daemon-flag.

  • fcsv (string) – csv-file
  • fimg (string) – Name of the result image-file

Parameters:

  • draw_roi (Bool) – Overdraw the ROI about the image (optional)
  • after_experiment (Bool) – Necessary if the project was loaded (optional)

camera¶

Interfaces¶

class camera.camera_interfaces.ICameraHandler¶

The camera-handler communicates with the other components and calls the functions of the selected camera-model

add_listener(listener)¶

Add a listener in the internal list to inform about modifications.

Parameters:listener (object) – Listener
download_last_image()¶

Downloads the last image in the full-resolution and as a preview

download_reference_image()¶

Downloads the last taken image and save it as the reference image

class camera.camera_interfaces.ICameraListener¶

Interface to inform the listeners about new images

update_downloaded_image(fname)¶

Updates the image

Parameters:fname (string) – Name of the file
update_downloaded_preview(fname)¶

Updates the preview

Parameters:fname (string) – Name of the file
class camera.camera_interfaces.ICameraProperties¶

Interface for the camera properties.

generate_next_file(f)¶

With the knowledge of the last file-name can the next file generated.

Parameters:f (string) – Name of the file
Returns:The generated file-name
Return type:string
load(name)¶

Loads the properties of the selected camera.

Parameters:name (string) – Name of the camera
save_properties()¶

Save the properties of the camera.

HTTP-Camera¶

class camera.http_camera.HTTPCameraHandler¶

Handles the communication with the components and the camera. The HTTPCameraHandler transfer the images via HTTP-request

download_last_image()¶

Downloads the last image in the full-resolution and as a preview

download_reference_image()¶

Downloads the last taken image and save it as the reference image

class camera.http_camera.HTTPCameraProperties(create_default=True)¶

Sets the camera properties with a HTTP-interface. By defaults will set the camera properties of the model Pentax K-70.

generate_next_file(f)¶

With the knowledge of the last file-name can the next file generated.

load(f)¶

Loads the properties by the given file.

Parameters:file (string) – File of the camera.
save_properties()¶

Save the properties of the camera.

selected_changed(selected_key)¶

Update the properties when the user select a new camera.

update_camera_models()¶

Updates the camera models in the Combobox.

update_properties(data)¶

Update the properties of the camera.

Parameters:data (Dictionary) – Properties of the camera.

Experiment¶

class experiment._experiment.Experiment(parent, record_mode)¶

The Experiment handles the interaction with the recorder of the application. The handler makes sure that a experiment can not started while it”s running. Furthermore the handler checks whether the experiment has all require properties before it can start.

create_reference_image()¶

Takes the reference image and transfer the image to the camera

get_correlation_properties()¶

Returns the properties for the correlation

get_recorded_values()¶

Returns the recorded values

get_user_serie_type()¶

Returns the series of the type

is_valid()¶

Checks whether the components of the experiment are valid

measuring_card_is_valid()¶

Checks whether the measuring card is valid

save()¶

Returns the properties of the experiment body

send_image()¶

Sends the last recorded image to the server

update_reference(f)¶

Updates the reference image

update_series(experiment)¶

Updates the series of the given experiment-type

Parameters:experiment (string) – Experiment-type

correlation¶

class experiment.correlation.methods.sensor.Sensor(name, points=[])¶

Represents a virtual travel sensor.

append_values(values)¶

Appends values from a image to the values container.

Parameters:values (List(float)) – Recorded values of the image.
get_average(arr, y, x)¶

Returns the average-value of the circle by the given positon.

get_average_values(arr)¶

Returns the average-value of the circles.

Parameters:arr (ndarray) – Values
Returns:Average values
Return type:float
get_values(index)¶

Returns the values of the given column-index. [u-displacement, v-displacement, strain_exx,strain_ex,strain_eyy]

Parameters:index (int.) – Index of the column.
Returns:The values of the column.
Return type:ndarray
static load(fpath, values=True)¶

Loads the properties of the travel-sensor.

Parameters:fpath (string.) – Name of the file
Returns:The loaded travel-sensor.
Return type:Sensor
save()¶

Saves the properties in a npy-file and json-file.

recorder¶

class experiment.recorder.phase_editor.phases.DialogPhase¶

Base class for the dialogs to create a instance of the subclasses of phase. The dialogs should checks all attributes and make sure that a invalid phase can not created.

load()¶

Create a instance of the class Phase with the attributes of the view.

Returns:Created phase
Return type:Phase
open_dialog()¶

Open the edit dialog

class experiment.recorder.phase_editor.phases.DialogPhaseTime¶

Dialog to create a instance of the class PhaseTime. The dialog checks all attributes and make sure that a invalid phase can not created.

Returns:Time based phase
Return type:PhaseTime

Returns:Value based phase
Return type:PhaseValue
class experiment.recorder.phase_editor.phases.Phase(experiment, name, reset=True, reset_time=0.1)¶

Base class for the phases. Every phase must implement a start-method and belongs a experiment. Optional the phase can have a name for a easy recognizing.

cancel()¶

Cancel the phase.

static load(args, experiment)¶

Create a instance with the given attributes

Parameters:
  • args (Dictionary) – Attributes which are saved in the json-file
  • experiment (ExperimentModel) – Related experiment
Returns:

Instance with the loaded attributes
Return type:

Phase
reset_phase()¶

Reset the phase.

save()¶

Returns the phase as a dictionary for a JSON file

Returns:Dictionary with all attributes of the phase
Return type:Dictionary
start()¶

Start the phase.

class experiment.recorder.experiment_recorder.ExperimentRecorder(parent, record_mode, camera_handler)¶

The ExperimentRecorder are the component of the Experiment which recorder the experiment. The Object make it possible to define phases with the PhaseEditor. Furthermore it address the measuring card and plot the records in a graph.

is_valid()¶

Checks whether the configuration of the components are valid

load()¶

Load the given phases

save_project()¶

Returns the port as a dictionary for a JSON file

Returns:Dictionary with all attributes of the port
Return type:Dictionary
send_image()¶

Upload the last recorded image

start()¶

Start the experiment.

use_all_ports(reset=True, reset_time=0.1)¶

Records all values of the input ports and save them in the recorder-object. Furthermore the method trigger a digital output signal to all output ports to take a picture.

Parameters:
  • reset (bool) – True if the port should reset, False otherwise
  • reset_time (float) – Time to pass to reset the port

measuring_card¶

Card¶

class measuring_card.card.MeasuringCard¶

MeasuringCard represents the measuring card and the functionality of the card. The class provides the reading of the ports and the digital triggering of the ports.

append_port(port)¶

Appends a port to the measuring card.

Parameters:port (Port) – Port which should be add.
Raises:ValueError
get_all_ports()¶

Returns all ports

Returns:All configured ports
Return type:List(Port)
get_port_name(port_id)¶

Returns the name by the given port-id

Parameters:port_id (int) – Id of the port.
Returns:Name of the port
Return type:str
Raises:ValueError
get_values_as_string()¶

“Returns the current values of the ports as a string

Returns:Recorded values as a string
Return type:string
input_port_exists(port_id)¶

Checks whether the given port id already exists.

Parameters:port_id (int) – Id of the port.
Returns:True if the id already exists, False otherwise.
Return type:bool
is_valid()¶

Checks whether the measuring card have all necessary ports and raises a ValueError if something is wrong.

Raises:ValueError
load()¶

Loads the properties of the measuring card from a json-file.

static load_input_ports()¶

Loads the input ports from a json-file.

static load_input_ports_as_dict()¶

Loads the input ports as a dictionary.

output_port_exists(port_id)¶

Checks whether the given port id already exists.

Parameters:port_id (int) – Id of the port.
Returns:True if the id already exists, False otherwise.
Return type:bool
record_all_ports()¶

Records the value of all ports.

Returns:List that contains tuples like (port_id, value)
Return type:List
record_port(port_id)¶

Records the value of the port by the given port-id.

Parameters:port_id (int) – Id of the port.
Returns:(port_id, value)
Return type:List
Raises:ValueError
save()¶

Saves the properties of the measuring card in a json-file.

trigger_all_ports(reset=True, reset_time=0.1)¶

Trigger a digital signal to all ports.

Parameters:
  • reset (bool) – True if the value should reset by a given time
  • reset_time (float) – Time to pass until reset the value
Returns:

True if the signal was sent, False otherwise
Return type:

bool
Raises:

ValueError
trigger_port(port_id, reset=False, reset_time=0)¶

Trigger a digital signal to the given port_id.

Parameters:
  • port_id (int) – Id of the Port.
  • reset (bool) – True if the value should reset by a given time
  • reset_time (float.) – Time to pass until reset the value
Returns:

True if the signal was sent, False otherwise
Return type:

bool
Raises:

ValueError

Ports¶

class measuring_card.ports.DialogPort¶

Base class for the dialogs to create a instance of the subclasses of port. The dialogs should checks all attributes and make sure that a invalid port can not created.

load()¶

Creates a instance of the class Por with the attributes of the view.

Returns:Port
open_dialog()¶

Open the dialog to input the values for the port.

Returns:True, if the user want create a port, False otherwise
Return type:bool

class measuring_card.ports.Port(board, port_id, name)¶

Base class for the ports. Every port must have a id , the id of the measuring card and know whether it is a input-port.

static load(args, card)¶

Creates a instance with the given attributes

Parameters:
  • args (Dictionary) – Attributes which are saved in the json-file
  • card (MeasuringCard) – Measuring card of the experiment
Returns:

Instance with the loaded attributes
Return type:

Port
save()¶

Returns the port as a dictionary for a JSON file

Returns:Dictionary with all attributes of the port
Return type:Dictionary
class measuring_card.ports.PortAI(board, port_id, scale_factor, offset, name, edit_dialog=None)¶

PortAI represents a analog input port. The class provide a method to read the analog input of the port and transform the value with the given scale-factor and the offset

class measuring_card.ports.PortDO(board, port_id, name, edit_dialog)¶

PortDO represents a digital output port. The class provide a method to trigger a digital signal.

trigger(reset_time=-1)¶

Triggers a digital signal.

Parameters:reset_time (float.) – Time (in seconds) to pass until reset the value. If the reset_time will not set, the trigger will change the electrical voltage.
Returns:True if the signal was sent, False otherwise.
Return type:bool
Raises:ValueError, ctypes.ArgumentError

server¶

Created on 17.11.2017

@author: mkennert

class server.smrc_server.SMRCConncetion(parent)¶

Handles the connection to the server

load_properties()¶

Returns the properties of the server. The method reads the properties from the configuration file. If the file does not exist, the method will create a new configuration file with the default properties.

Returns:Properties of the server
Return type:List
